1894843.other_requirements_text: Research Interns are expected to be physically located in their manager’s Microsoft worksite location for the duration of their internship. In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position as well as a cover letter and any relevant work or research samples. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

: Proven track record of successfully launching AI or machine learning features or products, with specialized expertise in large language models or conversational agents. Strong understanding of AI technologies, including natural language processing, generative AI, and computer vision. Exceptional eye for layout, typography, and visual storytelling; able to turn complex information into beautiful, engaging slides and documents. A thorough understanding of usability testing techniques, which drive an iterative design process, will significantly enhance the user's experience.

Expertise in cloud and AI technologies expertise to drive business outcomes across industries Proven track record for growing new businesses and building strong cross-company relationships with multi-disciplined stakeholders and senior executives. Exceptional leadership skills and community building must thrive working across highly matrixed organizational boundaries with strong ability to influence senior decision makers. Highly skilled in presenting insights in a concise, effective and influential manner to a variety of audiences, including senior executives, customers, media and industry analysts on a regular basis. Track record for building and landing audience-minded content that drives desired outcomes via modern channels. Ability to deeply assess the competition and drive perception-shifting efforts that differentiate Microsoft in credible, compelling ways. Results-driven self-starter who can prioritize and manage multiple projects, effectively driving to measurable results. The ability to work independently in ambiguous and changing environments, along with great listening and partnering skills. Additional or preferred qualifications Master's Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business or related field AND 6+ years experience in business OR Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business or related field AND 8+ years experience in business OR equivalent experience. 6+ years experience in in product marketing, product strategy or consulting. Product Marketing IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $106,400 - $203,600 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $137,600 - $222,600 per year. Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay Microsoft will accept applications for the role until October 25th, 2025

1893339.title: Technical Program Manager II
1893339.required_qualifications_text: : Bachelor's Degree AND 2+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data analysis, or product development OR equivalent experience. 2+ years experience managing cross-functional and/or cross-team projects. 2+ years experience managing technical projects consumer or commercial at scale device. Experience managing multiple projects in parallel with conflicting resources and similar timeline. Project planning (Agile and Waterfall) & tracking of feature development and validation. Experience with roadmap definition. Working knowledge of market/competing research along with customer needs. IHV/Partner management. Working knowledge of supply chain/sourcing. Versed with the latest trends in AI. Experience with bug triage.
1893339.other_requirements_text: : USB, TBT Connectivity and protocols. Experience with SoC (x86 and/or ARM).
1893339.preferred_qualifications_text: : Bachelor's Degree AND 4+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data analysis, or product development OR equivalent experience. 1893439.title: Senior Program Manager (Life Sciences Discovery)
locations: Redmond, Washington, United States + 1 more location
1893439.required_qualifications_text: : Bachelor's Degree in Biology, Bioinformatics, Chemistry, Computer Science (with life sciences focus) or related field AND 4+ years of hands-on R&D experience in life sciences or pharma with understanding of the end-to-end scientific research process – from literature review and hypothesis formulation to experimentation and data analysis – particularly in biology or pharmaceutical contexts. OR equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience managing complex, multi-stakeholder projects or programs, with proficient organizational skills to coordinate customer engagements, partner integrations, and internal development schedules, and a proven ability to solve problems, take initiative, and drive projects to successful completion. 3+ years of experience applying AI/ML or data analytics to scientific problems, with familiarity in modern AI approaches such as large language models, knowledge graphs, lab automation, and simulations, and the ability to clearly explain technical concepts, including multi-agent systems, model training, and cloud computing (Azure services, HPC) in the context of scientific research. Demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset, ownership, organization, system-level thinking to drive new products and iterate rapidly in ambiguous environments; adept at collaborating with customers and cross-disciplinary teams to bridge scientists and engineers, with competent communication skills for leading training sessions, presenting technical concepts to non-experts, and influencing decision-makers. Experience building partnerships or managing vendor relationships in the biotech/pharma R&D ecosystem, with a background in facilitating collaboration between technology teams and scientific stakeholders, such as in technology consulting for pharma or serving as a liaison between IT and R&D labs.
1893439.other_requirements_text: : Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
1893439.preferred_qualifications_text: : Agentic AI & Workflows: Experience with AI agents or dynamic workflow orchestration in any context (e.g. robotic process automation, autonomous lab systems, or multi-agent simulations). Cloud and Platform Skills: Hands-on experience with cloud-based data or ML platforms (Azure preferred). Familiarity with deploying or managing scientific applications on Azure (Azure ML, Azure Batch or HPC, cognitive services) and knowledge of Azure data security/compliance for life sciences (e.g. handling of PHI/PII data). Life Sciences Computing: Knowledge of common computational biology or chemistry tools (for example: molecular modeling software, bioinformatics pipelines, LIMS, ELN systems, etc.). Ability to assess and integrate such tools’ APIs or models into larger platforms. Publications/Patents: Track record of publications in relevant scientific or technical journals, or patents in AI for life sciences, demonstrating thought leadership in applying innovative technology to research. Other Requirements: Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: • Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Preferred qualifications: 5+ years of experience in high-tech Supply Chain or Sourcing 2+ years of experience in Management Consulting, Supply Chain Strategy or Corporate Strategy Experience in leading strategy projects involving cross functional teams MBA or Master’s degree in Supply Chain is a plus Experience in owning exec-level communications Demonstrated capability in driving analysis, problem-solving and strategic thinking Passionate not only in defining strategic agenda, but also in driving execution and delivering results Ability to influence and build lasting relationships Business Strategy IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $106,400 - $203,600 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $137,600 - $222,600 per year. Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay Microsoft will accept applications for the role until October 27, 2025.
Minimum qualifications:
• Master's Degree in Business Administration or related field AND 3+ years marketing, strategy, business planning, consulting, banking, finance, economics, and/or partner organization experience OR Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Liberal Arts, Computer Science, or related field AND 4+ years marketing, strategy, business planning, consulting, banking, finance, economics, and/or partner organization experience OR equivalent experience.
• 4+ years of experience in high-tech Supply Chain or Sourcing
• 2+ years of experience in Management Consulting, Supply Chain Strategy or Corporate Strategy
• Experience in qualitative and quantitative analysis.
• OR Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Liberal Arts, Computer Science, or related field AND 4+ years marketing, strategy, business planning, consulting, banking, finance, economics, and/or partner organization experience OR equivalent experience.
Other Requirements: Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: • Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Preferred qualifications:
• 5+ years of experience in high-tech Supply Chain or Sourcing
• 2+ years of experience in Management Consulting, Supply Chain Strategy or Corporate Strategy
• Experience in leading strategy projects involving cross functional teams
• MBA or Master’s degree in Supply Chain is a plus Experience in owning exec-level communications
• Demonstrated capability in driving analysis, problem-solving and strategic thinking
• Passionate not only in defining strategic agenda, but also in driving execution and delivering results
• Ability to influence and build lasting relationships
Business Strategy IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $106,400 - $203,600 per year. 1877882.required_qualifications_text: : Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Data Science, Cybersecurity, or related field AND 2+ years technical experience in software engineering, network engineering, service engineering, systems engineering, or industrial controls OR equivalent experience. 2+ year(s) technical experience working with large-scale cloud or distributed systems in support of enterprise-level customers
1877882.other_requirements_text:
: Candidates must be able to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements that are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Citizenship & Citizenship Verification: This position requires verification of United States citizenship due to citizenship-based legal restrictions. Specifically, this position supports United States federal, state, and/or local government agency customers and is subject to certain citizenship-based restrictions where required or permitted by applicable law. To meet this legal requirement, and as a condition of employment, the successful candidate’s citizenship will be verified with a valid passport. Preferred/Additional Qualifications: Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Data Science, Cybersecurity, or related field AND 3+ years technical experience in software engineering, network engineering, service engineering, systems engineering, or industrial controls OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Data Science, Cybersecurity, or related field AND 5+ years technical experience in software engineering, network engineering, service engineering, systems engineering, or industrial controls OR equivalent experience. Proficiency in in data analytics, data integration and data visualization and proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., C#, JavaScript). Proficiency in AI technologies, including knowledge in using, designing, and deploying intelligent agents and AI systems to automate and streamline business operations. Service Engineering IC3 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $100,600 - $199,000 per year. 1893385.required_qualifications_text: Master's Degree in Business Administration , Accounting, Finance, Economics, Data Science or related field OR Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration , Accounting, Finance, Economics, Data Science or related field AND 2+ years experience in financial analysis, accounting, controllership, finance, or related field OR equivalent experience 2 + years of experience building Excel models and leveraging financial systems for accurate analysis and reporting.
1893385.preferred_qualifications_text: Solid analytics and critical thinking accompanied with solid Excel modeling skills. Self-motivated; able to handle a high degree of ambiguity and quickly identify what needs to be accomplished across multiple concurrent workstreams and stakeholders, yet able to push back where needed. Business partnership experience with ability to influence others High level of self-motivation; ability to quickly identify what needs to be accomplished and resourcefulness to get things done Passion for technology and curious to further learn the how and why behind the numbers. Citizenship & Citizenship Verification: This role will require access to information that is controlled for export under export control regulations, potentially under the U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations or Export Administration Regulations, the EU Dual Use Regulation, and/or other export control regulations. As a condition of employment, the successful candidate will be required to provide proof of citizenship, U.S. permanent residency, or other protected status (e.g., under 8 U.S.C. § 1324b(a)(3)) for assessment of eligibility to access the export-controlled information. To meet this legal requirement, and as a condition of employment, the successful candidate’s citizenship will be verified with a valid passport. Lawful permanent residents, refugees, and asylees may verify status using other documents, where applicable. Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Experience building single page applications in React with state management and component libraries. Backend experience with FastAPI idioms (dependency injection, Pydantic models, OpenAPI ) and async patterns.
